text:
John Lewis was a true American hero and the moral compass of our nation. May his courage and conviction live on in all of us as we continue to make good trouble for justice and opportunity.
 
Rest in power, John.

.@RepJohnLewis: hero, champion & challenge to conscience of the nation. Your visit with the newest voices for justice at the Black Lives Matter mural with @MayorBowser was wonderful & iconic. Thank you for that final public statement in furtherance of a more perfect union. http://pbs.twimg.com/media/EdLs7NIX0AEvIHU.jpg

4/x Heidi & I are lifting up in prayer his family, his loved ones & all of America as we mourn the loss of a good and great man. His legacy will endure on, as we continue to strive for Justice for All. #RIPJohnLewis

3/x To say he was an icon, to say he was a hero, understates it. He had a quiet grace, a passion for justice & an indomitable courage that helped transform this Nation.

I am blessed & humbled to have known John & to have heard his deep wisdom firsthand.

2/x One of the original Freedom Riders, John was a young man at the dawn of the Civil Rights movement & he survived a brutal beating on the Edmund Pettus Bridge in Selma. 

At age 23, he was a keynote speaker at the March on Washington, on the steps of the Lincoln Memorial.

Tonight, the world grieves for the great John Lewis. In my 1st yr in the Senate, I had the privilege of traveling w/ John & much of the Congressional Black Caucus to Nelson Mandela’s funeral. The entire trip to Johannesburg, John regaled us w/ stories of being alongside Dr. King. http://pbs.twimg.com/media/EdLktiYXgAINlIY.jpg

John Lewis was and will always be an American hero and champion for civil rights, who inspired us all to make good trouble in the fight for justice. 

Rest in power, Rep. John Lewis.

With the passing of John Lewis, America has lost not only a man of history, but a man for our season; O how we need such men of unwavering principle, unassailable character, penetrating purpose, and heartfelt compassion.
30,000 vials of Remdesivir are en route to #Florida. Expect them tomorrow. This is enough to treat 5000 #COVID__19 patients. We appreciate everything @WhiteHouse did to make this happen.

The world is dimmer this morning without Congressman John Lewis in it.

He carried the baton of justice until the very end. It’s now on us to pick it up and march on. http://pbs.twimg.com/media/EdN1bDJWoAQUvPh.jpg

John Lewis inspired millions to fight for justice. His courage helped transform this country. He won’t ever be forgotten by those who believe America can change when the people stand together and demand it. Our thoughts are with his loved ones.

John Lewis inspired millions to fight for justice. His courage helped transform this country. He won’t ever be forgotten by those who believe America can change when the people stand together and demand it. Our thoughts are with his loved ones.

My heart is saddened. Last night John Lewis died, but for 80 years he showed us how to truly live.
 
Our hero is with God.
 
May we be his legacy.
 
May we love as courageously; serve as humbly; and until justice rolls down like water, may we always cause Good Trouble. http://pbs.twimg.com/media/EdNsjZUXoAItxH3.jpg

To say John Lewis was an icon or a hero is an understatement. I am humbled to have known John & to have heard his deep wisdom firsthand. Heidi & I are lifting up in prayer his family, his loved ones, and all of America as we mourn the loss of a good and great man. #RIPJohnLewis

Our beloved John Lewis was the conscience of the Congress but he was and remains the conscience of America, as well. On our journey to live up to our ideals, we have his entire life’s example of mirroring unearthed inequality with ever-enlarging dedication to justice for all. –NP
Let’s use the Defense Production Act and get every American the masks they need. https://www.cnn.com/2020/07/17/opinions/masks-for-all-covid-19-legislation-sanders-slavitt/index.html

RT @SteveDeaceShow I refuse to believe the nation that invented the telephone, microchip, radio, atom bomb, harnessed electricity, and put a man on the moon cannot figure out how to safely resume normal life while protecting the vulnerable from a virus that threatens almost no mortality below 55.

Against the wishes of state and local officials, unmarked federal agents in combat gear have invaded parts of Portland, Oregon. This is what a police state looks like.  These troops must be withdrawn immediately. We must defend the Constitution. We must defeat Trump.

RT @repjohnlewis Do not get lost in a sea of despair. Be hopeful, be optimistic. Our struggle is not the struggle of a day, a week, a month, or a year, it is the struggle of a lifetime. Never, ever be afraid to make some noise and get in good trouble, necessary trouble. #goodtrouble

There are simply no words to capture the enormous life and leadership of John Lewis. 

From his youth, John Lewis gave his blood, sweat, tears, and life in the struggle for a better nation.

To honor that gift is to fight for future generations, just as he fought for us. https://twitter.com/nytimes/status/1284336139445456897 QT @nytimes Breaking News: John Lewis has died at 80. A towering figure in the historic struggle for racial equality, he carried a mantle of moral authority into Congress. https://trib.al/LcDRUmI

Grateful to join @amjoyshow this morning on #AMJoy to talk about the incredible legacy of Congressman John Lewis. http://pbs.twimg.com/media/EdOPwlpX0AgZzqj.png https://video.twimg.com/amplify_video/1284522887450419200/vid/480x270/E9HIkioVZtpqy9El.mp4?tag=13
Kelley and I would like to give our condolences to the family of John Lewis. He was a monumental figure of the civil rights movement. RIP.

We don't need more nuclear weapons. We don't need more fighter jets.

We do need decent housing and health care for our people. http://pbs.twimg.com/amplify_video_thumb/1284244746018463747/img/rCNyPkHwvMc5Aspi.jpg https://video.twimg.com/amplify_video/1284244746018463747/vid/320x320/lWeSygzgEpEKSd8M.mp4?tag=13

Senator McConnell should honor @RepJohnLewis with more than words, and finally hold a vote this week on the Voting Rights Advancement Act to restore the key voting protections that John Lewis fought and bled for in the 1965 Voting Rights Act. https://twitter.com/senatemajldr/status/1284344881117364225 QT @senatemajldr My statement on the passing of Congressman John Lewis: http://pbs.twimg.com/media/EdLo3DuWAAAXJsE.jpg

John Lewis was a giant and a moral compass. I can’t wait to see what kind of good trouble these kids get into. https://twitter.com/BridgetMarie/status/1284335406000070657 QT @BridgetMarie My favorite thing about John Lewis is that at ComicCon, he cosplayed as his younger self, wearing the same coat and backpack he wore at the March on Selma and led kids in a little march around the convention. 🖤 http://pbs.twimg.com/media/EdLgPl3WkAAfPBq.jpg http://pbs.twimg.com/media/EdLgPlzXsAEWxNR.jpg http://pbs.twimg.com/media/EdLgPl5WoAAcaAx.jpg

RT @JoeBiden We are made in the image of God, and then there is John Lewis. He was truly one-of-a-kind, a moral compass who always knew where to point us and which direction to march. To John’s family, friends, staff, and constituents, Jill and I send you our love and prayers.

This is not Fallujah. This is not Beirut. This is America.

RT @nhannahjones Rep. John Lewis told me that the Supreme Court’s gutting of the Voting Rights Act in Shelby v Holder made him want to cry. Citizenship in this country is *defined* by the right to vote. Honor his legacy by asking Congress to restore the protections of the VRA. https://twitter.com/jeannetheoharis/status/1284447354435833856 QT @JeanneTheoharis The best way to honor John Lewis & C.T. Vivian is not with statements or even renaming the Edmund Pettus Bridge.  We must restore & expand the Voting Rights Act. We must insist members of Congress (including Mitch McConnell) actually get this done. Anything less is shameful. http://pbs.twimg.com/media/EdNFYJTX0AAZHV8.jpg

It was an honor to know & be blessed with the opportunity to serve in Congress with JohnLewis a genuine & historic American hero.

May the Lord grant him eternal peace. http://pbs.twimg.com/media/EdOrQKPXsAACmsX.jpg

TERRIBLE advice. Why are families disintegrating, kids being raised alone & angry? Today’s secular wisdom—“you’re mad your wife helped her family? Get a divorce!”—is a big reason why. 

Here, the wife acted poorly; they should have discussed it. But family matters. Kids matter. https://twitter.com/slate/status/1284507312837861376 QT @Slate #DearPrudie: They promise they’ll pay us back, but I know we’ll never see that money again. https://slate.com/human-interest/2020/07/dear-prudence-wife-savings-family-pyramid-scheme.html?via=rss_socialflow_twitter

Amidst the many crises we face, we cannot ignore that the climate crisis is getting worse. Now is the time to end our dependence on fossil fuels and move to renewable energy. Now is the time for a Green New Deal. https://www.bbc.com/news/science-environment-53415298

Good. 0% is the correct percent. https://twitter.com/kolas_yotaka/status/1284140129867542528 QT @Kolas_Yotaka 50% -> TSMC share of world semiconductor market
20% -> TSMC revenue from Huawei in 2019
0% -> TSMC sales to Huawei going forward
100% -> How much I support this

Taiwan's TSMC officially announced yesterday it will stop supplying Huawei. Key moments call for clear decisions.

C.T. Vivian was beaten by a Selma sheriff while registering Black Americans to vote. His leadership led to remarkable progress, but his fights—for racial justice, to end police brutality, to secure voting rights—aren't over.

We must keep fighting.

https://www.washingtonpost.com/local/obituaries/ct-vivian-king-aide-bloodied-on-the-front-lines-of-civil-rights-protest-dies-at-95/2020/07/17/a08e640c-c838-11ea-b037-f9711f89ee46_story.html

.@SimaforTX learned the values of freedom and opportunity as a young immigrant to America. Today, this mother, lawyer, and activist is committed to centering the needs of working families in #TX02 and to facing down those who would divide our nation with the politics of fear. http://pbs.twimg.com/media/EdO35hDWsAAAqwY.jpg

Christina @FinelloForPA will focus on the needs of struggling families in #PA01 by working to increase access to good, quality health care, create good-paying jobs that can never be outsourced, and improve safety and security for all of America’s children. http://pbs.twimg.com/media/EdO35IVX0AEo9pz.jpg

A granddaughter of sharecroppers and lawyer who worked for our first Black President, @TimsDesiree wants all children in #OH10 to have the same opportunity to achieve their American Dream with investments in quality health care and in schools that foster their potential. http://pbs.twimg.com/media/EdO34yvXgAEwZKi.jpg

Margaret @GoodforFlorida is looking forward to making a real difference in the lives of working families in #FL16 by bringing to the House the same dedication and common sense problem-solving that always guided her service as an attorney, non-profit leader, and legislator. http://pbs.twimg.com/media/EdO34WwWAAEfbmv.jpg

.@candacefor24 is a mom and educator whose lived experience informs her commitment to finding solutions in education policy that create opportunity for children and families in underserved communities. She will make history as the first Afro-Latina in Congress. #TX24 http://pbs.twimg.com/media/EdO33-YX0AIqKaG.jpg

A devoted mother of five and a former public school teacher, @AmyKennedy715 has a deep commitment and passion for education and for mental health advocacy and policy that will greatly benefit her work in the House #ForThePeople of #NJ02. http://pbs.twimg.com/media/EdO33hUXsAApj1M.jpg

John Lewis presided over the House vote to restore the Voting Rights Act. Mitch McConnell has had that legislation sitting on his desk for 225 days. 

It’s time for Congress to restore the Voting Rights Act.
